snippet: About 90 people who showed up for jury duty were exposed to images of cannibalism and told that, if selected, they would have to be ready to delve into “sexually violent and sexually deviant conduct.”
abstract: Potential jurors in pending trial of New York City Police Officer Gilberto Valle are shown images of cannibalism and told that, if selected, they will have to be ready to delve into 'sexually violent and sexually deviant conduct;' Valle is charged with planning to kidnap, kill and eat women.

headline.main: Wanted in Officer’s Trial: Difficult-to-Shock Jurors
headline.print_headline: Wanted in Officer’s Trial: Difficult-to-Shock Jurors

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include Bluefin Labs' genesis in a study of how a baby learned language, an indicator of the profitability of smartph...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include Bluefin Labs' genesis in a study of how a baby learned language, an indicator of the profitability of smartphone makers and a Web site that allows online tracking of plows in New York City during the big snowstorm.

headline.main: Week in Review: Just CC the Justice Department on Those E-Mails

snippet: Even with reforms meant to reduce conflicts of interest, many analysts failed to foresee a plunge in Apple’s shares.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column on the steep decline of Apple's stock, and how few analysts were able to foresee the plunge; says reforms put in place to reduce conflicts of interest affecting Wall Street research should have prevented the analysts' being blindsided, but they worked only up to a point; cites other factors that contributed to analysts' failure to recognize Apple's peak.

headline.main: Following a Herd of Bulls on Apple
headline.print_headline: Following A Herd Of Bulls On Apple

snippet: With deep pockets and a keen eye, Ted Sarandos is fusing Hollywood and Silicon Valley into a new TV paradigm.
abstract: With deep pockets and a keen eye, Ted Sarandos is fusing Hollywood and Silicon Valley into a new TV paradigm.

snippet: Analysts have been overwhelmingly bullish on Apple stock, even at $705 a share. Now that the stock has dropped 36 percent, they still recommend investors buy it, though some are starting to waver.
Citing the potential cost of fighting and losing a government lawsuit, Macmillan agreed to terms similar to those imposed on other major publishers who had settled.
